On 6/21/10 10:39 PM, meetme2meat wrote:
> Hello,
>
>       I am using Heritrix 3.1.1 Snapshot release. I have a script which launches jobs on a regular basis. I have around 15 jobs. I issue curl commands to launch and monitor the jobs.
>
> I have observed sometimes that the Heritrix UI freezes. Commands to launch new jobs freeze.
>
> On issuing a curl request to :
>
>    curl -k  -u admin:admin --anyauth --location https://localhost:8443/engine/
>
> The response I get is:
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------
> <head><title>Heritrix Engine 3.1.1-SNAPSHOT-20100603.010034</title>
> <base href='https://localhost:8443/engine/'/>
> <link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="static/engine.css"
> </head><body>
> <h1>Heritrix Engine 3.1.1-SNAPSHOT-20100603.010034</h1>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------
>
> Under normal scenarios it gives me complete listing of jobs.
>
> Is there any reason why this happens. I checked out the heritrix_out.log but got no information or error pertaining to this.

Have not seen this before.

Are the jobs continuing to make progress (as evidenced by direct 
inspection of their logs)?

Is that abbreviated response the complete response (the server gave a 
content-length representing the whole response, and closed the 
connection), or is your request 'hanging' waiting for more info?

Could be a deadlock, though if it had initially been triggered by a web 
request, I would expect further requests to also hang, rather than 
return any info.

What OS and JavaVM/version?

Does the 'jstack' tool (or info dumped to heritrix_out.log after a 
SIGQUIT signal is sent to the JVM process) show anything interesting? 
(Feel free to forward that dump to the list or to me directly for analysis.)

- Gordon @ IA
